citation.article-title: Natroniella acetigena gen. nov. sp. nov., an Extremely Haloalkaliphilic, Homoacetic Bacterium: A New Member of Haloanaerobiales

p.s: Natroniella acetigena (From Latin aceti from acetic acid and gena from genium-producing: organism that produces acetic acid)
Cells are large rods with rounded ends 1–1.2 μm 3 6–15 μm, motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Spore forming, spores round on the end of non-swollen cell.
In pure cultures rapid and complete lysis is characteristic of the isolated strain.
Chemoorganotrophic obligate anaerobe that ferments a very limited number of substrates to acetic acid.
Only lactate, pyruvate, glutamate, ethanol, propanol are utilized.
Yeast extract and vitamins stimulate growth.
Grows in highly alkaline NaCl-soda brines at salinities from 10 to 26% wt/vol with an optimum of 12–15% total salinity and in the pH range 8.1–10.7 with an optimum at pH 9.7–10.0.
Growth temperature optimum of 37°C and maximum temperature for growth 42°C.
Type strain Z-7937 (= DSM 9952) isolated from the bottom deposits of the soda lake, Lake Magadi, Kenya.
